TITLE: US lawmakers introduce bill to ban TikTok
SUMMARY: A trio of US lawmakers has introduced new legislation that aims to ban TikTok from operating in the United States.

TITLE: After meager rations in a Russian penal colony, Brittney Griner is welcomed back to the US with a Christmas tree and barbecue
SUMMARY: Freed from a Russian penal colony and back on American soil, WNBA star Brittney Griner got her first taste of a return to normal life over the weekend at a Texas military facility.

TITLE: Listen to the sound of Martian weather, recorded by the Perseverance rover
SUMMARY: A towering whirlwind of dust passed right over the Perseverance rover as it explored the site of an ancient lake on Mars. The rover recorded the first sounds of a Martian dust devil using its microphone.

TITLE: Criminal charges against former Michigan Gov. Rick Snyder related to Flint water crisis to be dismissed
SUMMARY: Criminal charges against former Michigan Gov. Rick Snyder will be dismissed, a recent court order shows.

TITLE: Father of missing US student studying in France pushes back against French prosecutor's statement
SUMMARY: Just days before he was supposed to come home for Christmas, an American college student studying in France is still missing as his father challenged the local prosecutor's claims about his son.

TITLE: House GOP divided over whether McCarthy should give in on 'motion to vacate'
SUMMARY: The House Republican Conference is still entrenched in an internal war over whether to reinstate an arcane rule that would empower any member to bring up a vote to oust a speaker at any time.

TITLE: Exclusive: US finalizing plans to send Patriot missile defense system to Ukraine
SUMMARY: The Biden administration is finalizing plans to send the Patriot missile defense system to Ukraine that could be announced as soon as this week, according to two US officials and a senior administration official.

TITLE: Storms with possible tornadoes rake Oklahoma and Texas -- injuring at least 7 -- as blizzard conditions mount in the northern Plains
SUMMARY: Severe storms including suspected tornadoes have carved paths of destruction in Oklahoma and the Dallas-Fort Worth area Tuesday and injured at least seven people -- part of a larger storm system that threatens more damage in the South and blizzard conditions in states farther north.

TITLE: FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried charged with fraud
SUMMARY: The Securities and Exchange Commission charged Sam Bankman-Fried on Tuesday with defrauding investors in his failed crypto exchange FTX. Follow live news updates here.

TITLE: 'Avatar: The Way of Water' rekindles the wonder in a way that demands to be seen
SUMMARY: James Cameron has done it again with "Avatar: The Way of Water," a state-of-the-art exercise that rekindles that sense of wonder and demands to be seen by anyone with lingering interest in watching movies in theaters.

TITLE: Congress gears up to pass short-term funding extension as partisan battle lines harden over broader deal
SUMMARY: Lawmakers still have no agreement on new funding levels for a massive full-year spending bill, casting doubt over whether the issue will be resolved by the end of the year and calling into question whether lawmakers may be forced to fund government at the same level as last year or punt talks to January, when Republicans take control of the House and the future of the bill could be even more perilous.

TITLE: Massive Martian dust devil passed over the Perseverance rover, and it recorded the eerie sounds
SUMMARY: A towering whirlwind of dust passed right over the NASA Perseverance rover as it explored the site of an ancient lake on Mars. The rover recorded the first sounds of a Martian dust devil using its microphone.

TITLE: 2022 In Review Fast Facts
SUMMARY: Read CNN's Fast Facts to learn more about the events of 2022.

TITLE: Los Angeles councilman will not resign amid audio scandal and scuffle with protester
SUMMARY: Days after video of a scuffle with an activist surfaced, and months after racist remarks on tape went viral, Los Angeles councilman Kevin de León tells CNN he will remain on the city council and is attending a scheduled meeting later Tuesday.

TITLE: Nawaz Sharif Fast Facts
SUMMARY: Read CNN's Fast Facts about Nawaz Sharif and learn more about the former prime minister of Pakistan.

TITLE: John Lewis to be honored on US postage stamp next year
SUMMARY: The late civil rights trailblazer and congressman John Lewis will be honored on a new postage stamp in 2023, the US Postal Service announced Tuesday.

TITLE: Recount reconfirms GOP Rep. Lauren Boebert's victory in Colorado's 3rd District
SUMMARY: A recount reconfirmed that GOP Rep. Lauren Boebert defeated Democrat Adam Frisch in Colorado's 3rd Congressional District, the Colorado secretary of state said this week.

TITLE: A trifecta of respiratory viruses -- Covid, RSV and flu -- is taxing hospitals across the nation
SUMMARY: Across the country, overflow health care workers are struggling to catch their breath as hospitals fill with sick patients battling a trifecta of respiratory illnesses -- Covid-19, RSV and the flu.

TITLE: Biden to sign into law same-sex marriage bill, 10 years after his famous Sunday show answer on the issue
SUMMARY: One Sunday morning in May of 2012, Vice President Joe Biden shocked the country with an unexpected declaration delivered in an interview on NBC's "Meet the Press": He came out in public support of same-sex marriage for the first time.

TITLE: Brittney Griner is back in the US and dunking again after almost 10 months detained in Russia
SUMMARY: Fresh off her elated return to the US after months in Russian custody, two-time Olympic gold medalist Brittney Griner is back on a basketball court.

TITLE: Inflation is finally falling. But the days when prices rose just 2% may never return
SUMMARY: For the first time in decades, people in Europe and North America have been forced to contend with the harsh consequences of rapid inflation. That's meant higher grocery bills, wages that don't stretch as far and savings that lose value. For some, it's meant choosing between heating their homes and putting food on the table.

TITLE: Deliberations in Harvey Weinstein's 2nd sexual assault trial continue for an 8th day in Los Angeles
SUMMARY: A Los Angeles jury met for an eighth day Tuesday in the second sexual assault trial of Harvey Weinstein, the disgraced movie mogul accused of using his Hollywood influence to lure women into private meetings and assault them.

TITLE: 'Kindred' gets lost in another time-travel tale that takes its sweet time
SUMMARY: After starting out well, "Kindred" gets lost in a maze of its own making, adapting Octavia E. Butler's time-traveling novel into an eight-part Hulu series that spends far too much time spinning its wheels. In that regard, it joins "The Time Traveler's Wife" and "Paper Girls" as recent examples of just how difficult this genre can be, offering scant compensation for the time spent watching them.

TITLE: Nevada, New Mexico and Georgia officials subpoenaed by DOJ for records related to 2020 election
SUMMARY: Local officials in Nevada, New Mexico and Georgia have received federal subpoenas for records related to the 2020 election as the Justice Department's investigation intensifies in battleground states.

TITLE: Dictionary.com's word of the year is 'woman'
SUMMARY: "Woman" is Dictionary.com's word of the year -- a word so simple and so common but nonetheless, according to the site, "inseparable from the story of 2022."

TITLE: Peru's former President Castillo denies charges as protest death toll rises
SUMMARY: Peru's former President Pedro Castillo has rejected allegations of conspiracy and rebellion, following his dramatic ouster and arrest last week. His appearance in court on Tuesday came amid ongoing protests by Castillo's supporters that have seen at least seven killed.

TITLE: Flint Water Crisis Fast Facts
SUMMARY: Read Fast Facts from CNN about the water crisis in Flint, Michigan.

TITLE: Controversial Police Encounters Fast Facts
SUMMARY: Read CNN's Fast Facts on controversial police encounters, including the beating of Rodney King.

TITLE: January 6 committee chairman: Final public meeting will be Monday and full report will come out December 21
SUMMARY: Rep. Bennie Thompson, the chairman of the House select committee investigating the January 6, 2021, insurrection, told reporters the committee will hold its final public meeting on Monday and that the panel's full report will come out December 21.

TITLE: Breakthrough Women Fast Facts: US Government, Education, Business and Sports
SUMMARY: View CNN's Fast Facts to learn more about US women breaking through the glass ceiling in government, education, business and sports.

TITLE: The trains that changed the way we travel in 2022
SUMMARY: The best new trains and rail routes of 2022: From Italian trains popping up around Europe to a new multi-day route across sub-Saharan Africa and Thailand's temporary 'floating train,' here are the new routes and rolling stock we loved this year.

TITLE: Opinion: Morocco and France's World Cup match offers something politics could never deliver
SUMMARY: The World Cup semifinal match between Morocco and France is historic in ways that the word itself cannot convey, writes Khaled A. Beydoun. Football offers many Morrocans living in an often-hostile France, as well as Africans, Muslims and and denizens of the Global South around the world what political realities cannot: an opportunity to confront and defeat the shadow of colonialism atop the field of play.

TITLE: 9 million people received emails that mistakenly said their student loan forgiveness was approved
SUMMARY: About nine million people received an email last month from the Department of Education that mistakenly said their application for student loan forgiveness had been approved, adding to the confusion surrounding President Joe Biden's debt relief program.

TITLE: Biden signs into law same-sex marriage bill, 10 years after his famous Sunday show answer on the issue
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden signed into law Tuesday landmark new federal protections for same-sex and interracial couples, capping both a personal and national evolution on an issue that's enjoyed growing acceptance over the past decade.

TITLE: Argentina overpowers Croatia to reach World Cup final as Lionel Messi's last dance dream remains alive
SUMMARY: Lionel Messi's lifelong dream of guiding Argentina to World Cup glory will remain alive until the last day of Qatar 2022, as La Albiceleste outclassed a weary-looking Croatia in a 3-0 victory in Tuesday's semifinal.

TITLE: DeSantis targets Covid vaccine manufacturers and CDC in latest anti-vaccine moves
SUMMARY: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis on Tuesday asked his state's Supreme Court to green-light an investigation of "any and all wrongdoing in Florida with respect to Covid-19 vaccines," his latest move to cast doubt on the vaccines' effectiveness and amplify fears about side effects.

TITLE: Storms with tornadoes rake Oklahoma and Texas -- injuring at least 7 -- as blizzard conditions mount in the northern Plains
SUMMARY: Severe storms including confirmed tornadoes have carved paths of destruction in Oklahoma and the Dallas-Fort Worth area Tuesday and injured at least seven people -- part of a larger storm system that threatens more damage in the South and blizzard conditions in states farther north.

TITLE: Danish bank pleads guilty to multi-billion dollar fraud scheme on U.S. Banks
SUMMARY: Federal prosecutors announced a plea deal and $2 billion forfeiture Tuesday with Danske Bank, one of Denmark's largest banks, for illegally allowing foreign actors to funnel money through their branch in Estonia in order to gain unlawful access to the US financial system.

TITLE: Indian billionaire Gautam Adani's flagship company is raising $2.5 billion
SUMMARY: Indian billionaire Gautam Adani's business empire is planning to raise nearly $2.5 billion in a new share offering as it pushes to expand into new areas.

TITLE: Angelo Badalamenti, 'Twin Peaks' composer, dies at 85
SUMMARY: Angelo Badalamenti, the composer behind several beloved soundtracks, including David Lynch's cult hit "Twin Peaks," has died at 85.

TITLE: US officials announce nuclear fusion breakthrough
SUMMARY: US officials announced Tuesday that researchers have produced a nuclear fusion reaction resulting in a net energy gain. Follow here for live news updates.

TITLE: Dow surges after inflation cools more than expected
Opinion: When Morocco faces off against France, the word 'history' won't be enough
SUMMARY: The World Cup semifinal match between Morocco and France is historic in ways that the word itself cannot convey, writes Khaled A. Beydoun. Football offers many Morrocans living in an often-hostile France, as well as Africans, Muslims and and denizens of the Global South around the world what political realities cannot: an opportunity to confront and defeat the shadow of colonialism atop the field of play.

TITLE: Covid-19 vaccines have saved more than 3 million lives in US, study says, but the fight isn't over
SUMMARY: The Covid-19 vaccines have kept more than 18.5 million people in the US out of the hospital and saved more than 3.2 million lives, a new study says -- and that estimate is most likely a conservative one, the researchers say.

TITLE: Hawaii's Mauna Loa and Kilauea volcanoes stop erupting within a day of each other. 'Is this a coincidence?'
SUMMARY: The magnificent volcanic light show that illuminated Hawaii's Big Island is over. Now, many are wondering why the Mauna Loa and Kilauea eruptions ended just one day apart.

TITLE: Justice Department has tried to access GOP Rep. Scott Perry's text messages
SUMMARY: The Justice Department has tried to gain access to Republican Rep. Scott Perry's text messages as part of a criminal investigation into 2020 election interference, facing off with his lawyers in a secret court proceeding after seizing his phone, CNN observed at the courthouse and sources familiar with the investigation said.

TITLE: Miles Morales takes another mind-bending trip in first trailer for 'Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse'
SUMMARY: After a breathtaking debut in 2018's Oscar-winning animated "Spider-Man: Into the Spider-Verse," Miles Morales is back for more universe-crossing adventures.

TITLE: House GOP divided over whether McCarthy should give in on 'motion to vacate'
SUMMARY: The House Republican Conference is still entrenched in an internal war over whether to reinstate an arcane rule that would empower any member to bring up a vote to oust a speaker at any time.

TITLE: December 13, 2022 Argentina vs Croatia and other World Cup news
SUMMARY: Argentina is through to the World Cup final after dominating Croatia with a 3-0 victory on Tuesday in Qatar. Superstar Lionel Messi dazzled with a goal and assist.

TITLE: Impeachment effort will only complicate the immigration puzzle
SUMMARY: Immigration, always simmering in the American political conversation, could take on new importance with a "surge" at the border, the end of Title 42, a doomed impeachment effort and the slim possibility of a bipartisan win before the year is done.

TITLE: Breonna Taylor's boyfriend reaches $2 million settlement with City of Louisville
SUMMARY: Breonna Taylor's boyfriend, Kenneth Walker III, has reached a $2 million dollar settlement with the City of Louisville, resolving lawsuits Walker filed in response to "the unlawful police raid that led to Ms. Taylor's death," a news release from Walker's legal team says.

TITLE: What is Title 42, and how does it connect to what's happening now in El Paso?
SUMMARY: A growing number of migrants are crossing the border near El Paso, Texas, and statements from officials there are adding fuel to debate over the looming end of Title 42 -- and how authorities will respond.

TITLE: Eric Adams: The myths about Black Democrats
SUMMARY: With the proposal to move its first presidential primary in 2024 to South Carolina, the Democratic Party is sending a clear message: It's is prioritizing Black voters, writes New York City Mayor Eric Adams.

TITLE: Opinion: Arizona governor's immigration stunt isn't fooling anyone
SUMMARY: Looking to score political points, Arizona Gov. Doug Ducey has been building a border 'wall' out of empty shipping containers -- a project that's likely illegal, expensive, ineffective and dangerous, writes Raul A. Reyes.

TITLE: 'Harry & Meghan' is Netflix's most watched documentary debut in its first week
SUMMARY: Netflix's documentary about Prince Harry and Meghan, Duchess of Sussex, debuted with a total of 81.55 million hours watched in its first week, the company said in a press release Tuesday. That's the highest viewing time of any documentary to debut on the streaming service in its premiere week.

TITLE: Top Energy Department official no longer employed after luggage theft accusations
SUMMARY: The Department of Energy official responsible for nuclear fuel and radioactive waste is no longer employed by the federal agency after two alleged airport baggage theft incidents, according to local reports and court records.

TITLE: Skeletal remains found in 1991 identified 31 years later using forensic genealogy
SUMMARY: The mystery of skeletal remains hunters found in 1991 on a private farm lane in Pickaway County, Ohio, long remained just that: a mystery.

TITLE: US DOJ charges 5 Russian and 2 US nationals with conspiring to violate sanctions by smuggling equipment to Russian military
SUMMARY: The US Justice Department has charged five Russian nationals and two US nationals for allegedly conspiring to violate US sanctions by smuggling US-made equipment to the Russian military, according to a recently unsealed indictment.

TITLE: A trifecta of respiratory viruses -- Covid, RSV and flu -- is taxing hospitals across the nation
SUMMARY: Across the country, overflow health care workers are struggling to catch their breath as hospitals fill with sick patients battling a trifecta of respiratory illnesses -- Covid-19, RSV and the flu.

TITLE: Everything you need to know about the FTX saga that unfolded today
SUMMARY: John J. Ray III, who made his name overseeing the liquidation of Enron in the early 2000s, is the man in charge of sifting through the rubble of FTX, the once-mighty cryptocurrency exchange — founded in 2019 and run into the ground by 2022 by Sam Bankman-Fried.

TITLE: Deliberations in Harvey Weinstein's 2nd sexual assault trial will continue Wednesday for a 9th day
SUMMARY: A Los Angeles jury met for an eighth day Tuesday in the second sexual assault trial of Harvey Weinstein, the disgraced movie mogul accused of using his Hollywood influence to lure women into private meetings and assault them.

TITLE: El Paso faced a 'major surge in illegal crossings' over the weekend, senior border official says
SUMMARY: More than 2,400 migrants crossed into the United States near El Paso, Texas, daily over the weekend, according to a senior Border Patrol official, marking what he described as a "major surge in illegal crossings" in the region.

TITLE: Negotiators announce bipartisan framework agreement for government funding package
SUMMARY: Top congressional negotiators announced Tuesday evening that an agreement had been reached for a framework that should allow lawmakers to complete a sweeping full-year government funding package.

TITLE: McCarthy and McConnell on collision course as Congress barrels toward messy finish
SUMMARY: House GOP Leader Kevin McCarthy took to Fox News primetime last week and dinged his counterpart across the Capitol: Senate GOP Leader Mitch McConnell.

TITLE: Opinion: America is playing catch-up in Africa
SUMMARY: For far too long, the United States has treated Africa as an afterthought, much to Washington's peril. US leaders have allowed rivals like China and Russia to deepen their ties -- both economic and political -- while America twiddles its thumbs on the sidelines, writes Joyce Davis. President Biden's US-Africa summit is Washington is a critical step to improving ties with nations from that continent.

TITLE: Africa's World Cup: how a continent that usually underperforms finally got it right
SUMMARY: After the first round of games at the World Cup, an all too familiar script looked to be playing out for African football fans. Five games played, three losses, two draws and only Ghana putting the ball in the back of the net in a defeat by Portugal.

TITLE: Jay Leno details how his 'face caught on fire' in first interview since accident
SUMMARY: Jay Leno has opened up for the first time about the accident that left him with severe burns to his face and body.

TITLE: Los Angeles councilman will not resign amid audio scandal and scuffle with protester
SUMMARY: Days after video of a scuffle with an activist surfaced, and months after racist remarks on tape went viral, Los Angeles councilman Kevin de León told CNN he will remain on the city council but again faced protests at the council's scheduled meeting Tuesday.

TITLE: Eric Adams: Democrats can no longer take these voters for granted
SUMMARY: With the proposal to move its first presidential primary in 2024 to South Carolina, the Democratic Party is sending a clear message: It's is prioritizing Black voters, writes New York City Mayor Eric Adams.

TITLE: Morocco on the verge of World Cup final but face toughest test against France
SUMMARY: Morocco has experienced a World Cup fairytale like no other.

TITLE: 3 dead and foreign nationals injured after gunmen attack Kabul hotel
SUMMARY: Three people were killed and many others injured after gunmen attacked a hotel in Kabul, the Afghan capital, on Monday.

TITLE: Today's news in 10 minutes
SUMMARY: December 14, 2022

TITLE: Ban TikTok? How Republicans are 'playing to the Fox News crowd' with attacks on the social media app
SUMMARY: Republicans are escalating their attacks on TikTok.

TITLE: 'There are maniacs who enjoy killing,' Russian defector says of his former unit accused of war crimes in Bucha
SUMMARY: Nikita Chibrin says he still remembers his fellow Russian soldiers running away after allegedly raping two Ukrainian women during their deployment northwest of Kyiv in March.

TITLE: At least 5 tornadoes confirmed in Texas as storms roll through southwestern US and blizzard conditions mount in the northern Plains
SUMMARY: At least five tornadoes were confirmed in Texas during a storm outbreak Tuesday, according to the National Weather Service in Fort Worth.

TITLE: Oregon governor calls death penalty 'immoral,' commutes sentences for all 17 inmates on death row
SUMMARY: Outgoing Oregon Gov. Kate Brown is commuting the sentences of all 17 people on death row to life imprisonment without the possibility of parole, according to a news release Tuesday from her office.

TITLE: December 13, 2022 Russia-Ukraine news
SUMMARY: The Biden administration is finalizing plans to send an advanced long-range air defense system to Ukraine to help counter Russian attacks, according to US officials.

TITLE: Visa wait times of over 2 years are keeping Indian travelers out of the US
SUMMARY: Some US consulates and embassies have wait times of more than two years to get an interview for a tourist visa. According to experts, that's hurting the country's tourism industry.

TITLE: Dow surges after inflation cools more than expected
SUMMARY: Stocks rose after a consequential inflation report showed inflation cooled much more than expected.

TITLE: First on CNN: Biden administration to pilot new portions of citizenship test next year
SUMMARY: The Biden administration plans to conduct a trial for portions of the naturalization exam, which immigrants must pass to become US citizens, next year, to try to make the test more accessible, US Citizenship and Immigration Services will announce Wednesday.
